botanical_details.genus: Fuchsia can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs or trees, rarely perennials, with opposite or whorled leaves and usually pendent flowers with conspicuous tubular calyx, 4 spreading sepals and 4 erect petals

cultivation.text: Ideal for growing under glass or in containers that can be brought indoors to overwinter. Ideal for growing under glass or in containers that can be brought indoors to overwinter. Grow in moist but well-drained potting compost, in bright filtered light with good ventilation. When in growth apply a liquid balanced fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist over winter. See tender fuchsia cultivation for more detailed advice but well-drained potting compost, in bright filtered light with good ventilation. When in growth apply a liquid balanced fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist over winter. See tender fuchsia cultivation for more detailed advice fertile, moist but well-drained soil in full sun or part shade in a sheltered position, kept frost free over winter. Keep just moist in winter. See tender fuchsia cultivation for further information

propagation.text: Propagate by softwood or semi-hardwood cuttings

pests.text: May be susceptible to aphids, capsid bug, fuchsia gall mite and vine weevil

diseases.text: May be susceptible to fuchsia rust and grey moulds fuchsia rust and grey moulds
